title: Failed to register the Ethereum service: incompatible state scheme, stored: hash, provided: path
body:
#### System information

Geth version: `1.13.0` and `1.13.5`
CL client & version: lighthouse@v4.5.0
OS & Version: Linux

#### Expected behaviour
My client has been on 1.13.0 since it was released. I left just the ancients, and resynced using `--state.scheme=path`. Today, geth started missing attestations, being stuck in a start-up loop with this error: `Failed to register the Ethereum service: incompatible state scheme, stored: hash, provided: path`.

Any ideas on what happened here? or what I could do to get my client back online?

I tried updating the client to `1.13.5` and I was receiving the same error on start-up

Full log output:
```
Started Geth Execution Client. 
INFO [11-30|22:16:12.047] Starting Geth on Ethereum mainnet... 
INFO [11-30|22:16:12.047] Bumping default cache on mainnet         provided=1024 updated=4096 
INFO [11-30|22:16:12.047] Enabling metrics collection 
INFO [11-30|22:16:12.047] Enabling stand-alone metrics HTTP endpoint address=127.0.0.1:6060 
INFO [11-30|22:16:12.047] Starting metrics server                  addr=http://127.0.0.1:6060/debug/metrics 
INFO [11-30|22:16:12.048] Maximum peer count                       ETH=50 LES=0 total=50 
INFO [11-30|22:16:12.049] Smartcard socket not found, disabling    err="stat /run/pcscd/pcscd.comm: no such file or directory" 
INFO [11-30|22:16:12.051] Set global gas cap                       cap=50,000,000 
INFO [11-30|22:16:12.051] Initializing the KZG library             backend=gokzg 
INFO [11-30|22:16:12.066] Allocated trie memory caches             clean=614.00MiB dirty=1024.00MiB 
INFO [11-30|22:16:12.151] Using pebble as the backing database 
INFO [11-30|22:16:12.151] Allocated cache and file handles         database=/var/lib/geth/geth/chaindata cache=2.00GiB handles=262,144 
INFO [11-30|22:16:13.197] Opened ancient database                  database=/var/lib/geth/geth/chaindata/ancient/chain readonly=false 
Fatal: Failed to register the Ethereum service: incompatible state scheme, stored: hash, provided: path 
geth.service: Main process exited, code=exited, status=1/FAILURE 
geth.service: Failed with result 'exit-code'. 
geth.service: Consumed 2.486s CPU time. 
```

Well, it appears that what is stored on disk is _not_ `scheme=path`, but `scheme=hash`. 

I don't suppose you have any older logs for the last time you booted it, when it was still working?

Right, this is why its so confusing. Because I have been using `scheme=path` since September.

I dont have logs from the last time it booted successfully since that was weeks ago, all i have is the logs from the moment it started crashing:

